duties_responsibilities.duty: Ensure compliance with project management standards and policy in project control functions.
Develop integrated master schedule, master risk register, and spend forecast using standard tools.
Support project management team in evaluation and impact assessment of project risks.
Collect ongoing progress and performance data from Engineering systems or project management team.
Integrate external cost and schedule data to enable accurate performance reporting.
Provide subject matter expertise to senior management on construction and/or engineering schedule management.
Manage project or portfolio controls data in approved systems and tools.
Train and mentor junior team members with schedule management and project controls responsibilities.
Support development of cost engineering policies, procedures, and performance metrics.
Prepare and deliver related reports, or presentations.
Manage consulting contracts or task orders and/or supervise consultant staff.
Perform review and analysis of contractor or third-party baseline and schedule updates.
Provide advice and analyses on project delay claims or disputes.
Assure quality and timeliness of recurring and ad-hoc team deliverables.
Ensure integration of scheduling and cost engineering practices and methods.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's Degree in Construction Management, Engineering, Science, or a related field (Master's preferred)
PMP or PMI-SP certification in good standing
